data.enText: to put sth in a place where people can see it easily; to show sth to people

data.chText: 这次展览为当地艺术家提供了展示自己作品的机会。
data.enText: The exhibition gives local artists an opportunity to display their work.

data.chText: 她将自己身上青一块紫一块的伤痕露出来给大家看。
data.enText: She displayed her bruises for all to see.

data.chText: 显示，显露，表现（特性或情感等）
data.enText: to show signs of sth, especially a quality or feeling

data.chText: 我难得见到她将喜怒形于色。
data.enText: I have rarely seen her display any sign of emotion.

data.chText: 这些统计数据表现出一种明显的趋势。
data.enText: These statistics display a definite trend.
to show information

data.chText: 屏幕将在右上角显示用户名。
data.enText: The screen will display the username in the top right-hand corner.
This column displays the title of the mail message.
to show a special pattern of behaviour that is intended to attract a female bird or animal
an arrangement of things in a public place to inform or entertain people or advertise sth for sale

data.chText: 市政厅外陈设的美丽的花
data.enText: a beautiful floral display outside the Town Hall
a window display
a display cabinet
an act of performing a skill or of showing sth happening, in order to entertain
a firework display
a breathtaking display of aerobatics

data.chText: （特性、情感或能力的）显示，表现，表露
data.enText: an occasion when you show a particular quality, feeling or ability by the way that you behave

data.chText: 爱的流露；实力的显示；财富的炫耀
data.enText: a display of affection/strength/wealth
the words, pictures, etc. shown on a computer screen
a high resolution colour display
on display
put in a place where people can look at it

data.chText: 新体育馆的设计图展示在图书馆里。
data.enText: Designs for the new sports hall are on display in the library.
to put sth on temporary/permanent display

means: 显露，表现(特性或情感等)
(特性、情感或能力的)显示，表现，表露

ex.chText: 他演示了新装置是如何工作的。
ex.enText: He demonstrated how the new device works.

ex.chText: 她展示了赢得竞赛的能力。
ex.enText: She has demonstrated/displayed an ability to win the competition.

synonyms.bx: 指演示如何做某事或某事的工作原理；也可指表露出某种感情、能力或素质，作此义解时常可与 display 换用。

ex.chText: 一座新出土的青铜雕像被放在大厅中央展示。
ex.enText: A newly unearthed bronze statue is displayed in the centre of the hall.

ex.chText: 最新的数据将发布在布告板上。
ex.enText: The latest statistics will be displayed on the billboard.

ex.chText: 参观博物馆的时候，她表现出很感兴趣的样子。
ex.enText: She displayed great interest when visiting the museum.

synonyms.bx: 常指将某物摆放在显眼之处；也指显露某种感情、态度或特质。

ex.chText: 给警察看看你的身份证。
ex.enText: Show your ID card to the police.

ex.chText: 那个人咧着嘴笑，露出一口白牙。
ex.enText: The man grinned, showing his white teeth.
Please show me how to make spaghetti.

synonyms.bx: 指有意或无意地把东西给别人看，也指通过示范教某人做某事。

data.enText: on display
put in a place where people can look at it

data.chText: 新体育馆的设计图展示在图书馆里。
data.enText: Designs for the new sports hall are on display in the library.
to put sth on temporary/permanent display

example: the museum had many exhibits of oriental art

tr: an electronic device that represents information in visual form
something intended to communicate a particular impression
example: a good show of looking interested

tr: behavior that makes your feelings public
to show, make visible or apparent
example: The Metropolitan Museum is exhibiting Goya's works this month
Why don't you show your nice legs and wear shorter skirts?
National leaders will have to display the highest skills of statesmanship

tr: attract attention by displaying some body part or posing

value.def: If you display something that you want people to see, you put it in a particular place, so that people can see it easily.

example.ex: Among the protesters and war veterans proudly displaying their medals was Aubrey Rose...
example.tran: 在抗议者和骄傲地展示勋章的退伍老兵中，就有奥布里·罗斯。

example.ex: The cabinets display seventeenth-century blue-and-white porcelain.
example.tran: 展柜中陈列着17世纪的青花瓷。

example.ex: Most of the other artists whose work is on display were his pupils or colleagues.
example.tran: 其他参展的艺术家大多是他的学生或同事。

value.def: If you display something, you show it to people.

example.ex: She displayed her wound to the twelve gentlemen of the jury...
example.tran: 她给陪审团的 12 位男士看了她的伤口。

example.ex: The chart can then display the links connecting these groups.
example.tran: 这张图就会显示出这些群体之间的关联。

value.def: If you display a characteristic, quality, or emotion, you behave in a way which shows that you have it.

example.ex: It was unlike Gordon to display his feelings...
example.tran: 戈登不太可能表露他的情感。

example.ex: He has displayed remarkable courage in his efforts to reform the party.
example.tran: 在政党改革中，他表现出了非凡的勇气。

example.ex: Normally, such an outward display of affection is reserved for his mother.
example.tran: 通常，只有在母亲面前他的情感才会如此外露。

value.tran: 显示，显露，表现(特性或情感)

value.def: When a computer displays information, it shows it on a screen.

example.ex: They started out by looking at the computer screens which display the images...
example.tran: 他们开始在显示那些图像的电脑屏幕上寻找。

example.ex: Using the option to display only text speeds things up a lot.
example.tran: 选用纯文本显示可以使速度大幅提升。

value.def: A display is an arrangement of things that have been put in a particular place, so that people can see them easily.

example.ex: She was leaning against a display case of prints of Paris.
example.tran: 她正倚靠在一个展示巴黎照片的陈列柜上。

value.def: A display is a public performance or other event which is intended to entertain people.

example.ex: ...the Royal Air Force Red Arrows display team.

value.def: The display on a computer screen is the information that is shown there. The screen itself can also be referred to as the display .

example.ex: A hard copy of the screen display can also be obtained from a printer.
example.tran: 屏幕上显示的内容也可以通过打印机打印一份。

example.ex: ...obscure error messages appearing on the display.
example.tran: 显示器上出现的令人费解的错误信息

value.tran: (计算机屏幕上的)显示，显像;显示器
